title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 16 ยง 890.93 - Negative option promotional practices
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 16 ยง 890.93 - Negative option promotional practices

State Regulations
(a) No cable television company may bill any
subscriber for any service not affirmatively requested by the
subscriber. (b) For purposes of
this section, a subscriber's affirmative request need not be in writing, but
any cable television company relying on an oral affirmative request shall keep
records of the date on which, and the employee to whom, the request was
made. (c) For purposes of this
section, a subscriber shall be deemed to have affirmatively requested service
if: (1)
the subscriber voluntarily makes
payment for such service after an initial trial period; and
(2)
there was included, in the notice or
advertising material describing the service, a statement clearly advising the
subscriber that no obligation to pay for such service has been incurred and
that no action is necessary to avoid incurring any such obligation. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 16
ยง
890.93

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
